title: Induced emf - inductor with time dependent current

content.question: The current as a function of time in a circuit that includes an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is given by the equation <math alttext="I equals, C times the square root of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt></math>, where <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> is a positive constant with appropriate units. Which of the following is an equation for the <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> across the inductor as a function of time?

choices.label: <math alttext="open E equals, negative L times the fraction with numerator C, and denominator the square root of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mi>C</mi><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="open E equals, negative L times the fraction with numerator C, and denominator 2 times the square root of t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mi>C</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="open E equals, negative two thirds times L C, times open parenthesis, the square root of t, close parenthesis cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>C</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="open E equals, negative one third times L C, times open parenthesis, the square root of t, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>L</mi><mi>C</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open E equals, negative L times the fraction with numerator C, and denominator 2 times the square root of t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mi>C</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mi>t</mi></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
